text: A novel interferon regulatory factor family transcription factor , <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> Pip <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> LSIRF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , that negatively regulates the activity of interferon - regulated genes .

We have isolated a novel cDNA clone encoding <extra_id_0> interferon (IFN) consensus sequence-binding protein in adult T-cell leukemia cell line or activated T cells <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) ; this protein is the human homolog of the recently cloned <extra_id_0> Pip <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> LSIRF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

<extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is structurally most closely related to the previously cloned <extra_id_0> ICSBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a member of the IFN regulatory factor ( IRF ) family of proteins that binds to interferon consensus sequences ( ICSs ) found in many promoters of the IFN - regulated genes .
Among T-cell lines investigated , <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was abundantly expressed in human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( HTLV-1 ) - infected T cells .

When the HTLV-1 <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was expressed or phorbol myristake acetate-A23187 stimulation was used , <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was induced in Jurkat cells which otherwise do not express <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: When the binding of <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to four different ICSs was tested , the relative differences in binding affinities for those ICSs were determined .
To study the functional role of <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we performed cotransfection experiments with the human embryonal carcinoma cell line N - Tera2 .

<extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was demonstrated to possess repressive function over the gene activation induced by IFN stimulation or by <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cotransfection .

text: Such repressive function is similar to that seen in <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> ICSBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

However , we have found that <extra_id_0> ICSAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has a different repressive effect from that of <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> ICSBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in some IFN - responsive reporter constructs .

These results suggest that a novel mechanism of gene regulation by " differential repression " is used by multiple members of repressor proteins with different repressive effects on the IFN - responsive genes .
